subject: Re: [junit] Multiple assertions per test
msgSnippet: ... I think we ve lost sight of this thread: it was about multiple assertion /failures/ per test, and not multiple assertions per test. It s possible the
messageBody:
David Saff wrote:
>
> Stephen Smith wrote:
> > I'm in two minds. One assertion per test case produces clean code and
> > it's a noble sentiment I strive towards, but when test cases involve
> > talking to software outside of my control (by which I mean
> > poorly-implemented third party applications) the temptation to have
> > multiple assertions in a single test case is sometimes too great.
> >
>
> Can you give a specific example? I've felt this temptation, too.
> Sometimes, by introducing an Adapter around the poorly-designed API, I
> can both get to a one-assertion test, and provide an interface to the
> third-party code that makes the rest of my code cleaner. I wonder if
> this is true in your case.

I think we've lost sight of this thread: it was about multiple assertion
/failures/ per test, and not multiple assertions per test.

It's possible the thread morphed on me while I wasn't looking, but I
wanted to make that point sooner than later.

Take care.
